channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Campbell’s promises its soups are not made with 3D printed meat
item.description: Campbell’s is insisting that its soups aren’t made with 3D-printed chicken, lab-grown chicken, or bioengineered meat. The food giant issued the explanation on its website after leaked audio allegedly captured Campbell’s vice president of information technology saying the company’s meat “came from a 3D printer.” “A recent video contained false comments about our ingredients,” Campbell’s […]...

item.title: House overhauls KOSA in a new kids online safety package
item.description: The House Energy and Commerce Committee released a package of 19 bills aimed at protecting kids on the internet, teeing Congress up for a chance at passing some of the most substantive internet regulations in recent history, alongside a fight over online speech rights. The subcommittee on commerce will consider the bills during a hearing […]

item.title: Controversial New Study Points to the Most Promising Dark Matter Signal Yet
item.description: A researcher identified gamma ray emissions that appear to have originated from dark matter, but other physicists still aren’t convinced.

item.title: Why Is Everyone in ‘Wicked: For Good’ Obsessed With Clock Ticks?
item.description: Both the musical and its movie adaptation largely leave out a key piece of worldbuilding from Gregory Maguire's novels—making the repeated use of 'Clock Tick' in 'For Good' come off weirder than any other Oz-ism.

item.title: 'The leap is insane': Salesforce CEO swaps ChatGPT for Gemini 3 and says he's 'not going back'
item.description: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff’s surprise switch from ChatGPT to Gemini 3 highlights how quickly AI preferences can change as new models raise the bar.

item.title: Why ‘hold forever’ investors are snapping up venture capital ‘zombies’
item.description: An investor explains the "buy, fix, and hold" model employed by Bending Spoons and similar companies that buy distressed startups.

item.title: White House Hopes to Save Elon From Testifying in DOGE Lawsuit
item.description: The government has argued that exceptional circumstances need to be met for such a deposition.

item.title: 25 of the best Black Friday deals under $50
item.description: Black Friday deals under $50 include Lego sets, JBL speakers, Anker Soundcore earbuds, Amazon Echo devices, Blink home security, and more.

item.title: Geekom's new laptop offers a bright and wide screen, impressive hardware - and weighs less than a bag of sugar
item.description: Geekom GeekBook X14 Pro delivers an ultra-light design, Intel Core Ultra performance, OLED display, and long battery life.

item.title: The best Black Friday deals under $25: Apple AirTag, Echo Pop, Fire TV Stick
item.description: We've rounded up all the best Black Friday deals under $25, including Apple AirTags, Echo Pop speakers, and Fire TV Sticks.

item.title: YouTube is working on a feature that will fix the messy home feed
item.description: YouTube is experimenting with a new feature that allows users to customize their home feed.

item.title: The best QLED and OLED TVs you can buy in 2025 are all on sale for Black Friday — save up to $1,800
item.description: Best Buy and Amazon Black Friday TV deals go incredibly hard in 2025. There are a ton of cheap 65-inch QLEDs, plus affordable OLEDs.

item.title: Possible Windows 11 bug with Nvidia GPUs tanks Assassin's Creed Shadows performance, bringing even an RTX 5090 to its knees
item.description: Nvidia recently issued a hotfix for a bug possibly caused by the Windows 11 October update, but it wasn't clear just how bad this glitch was.

item.title: Tesla debunked by regulator over Full-Self Driving approval claim
item.description: A Dutch regulator has debunked Tesla's claims that Full Self-Driving was approved in Europe.

item.title: 85 Black Friday deals: We found record-low prices on AirPods, MacBooks, TCL TVs, Kindles, and Ninjas
item.description: Get the latest Black Friday deals on Apple products, vacuums, headphones, power stations, and Legos. Save $250 on a new Apple laptop and 27% on a new Kindle.

item.title: The top 5 beauty deals of Black Friday, sourced by someone who tests beauty tech
item.description: Whether shopping for yourself or for a friend, you'll want to see these deals our beauty tech expert found on products like the Shark FlexStyle, Dyson Supersonic Nural, and Dyson Airwrap.

item.title: Character.AI debuts choose-your-own-adventure Stories for teens
item.description: Character.AI's newest feature comes after the company banned open-ended chats for teens.

item.title: It’s Good That the ‘Destiny 2’ Jedi Proxy Also Kind of Sounds Like They Suck
item.description: If the 'Destiny 2' expansion's 'Star Wars' crossover means it wants to tell a story that captures the vibe of the galaxy far, far away, then it's doing a good job so far with the Praxic Order.

item.title: RAM price rise hell is making me think the unthinkable – could the PS5 be a better buy than a Steam Machine?
item.description: I just bought a PS5 Pro in the Black Friday sales, and hearing this news has made me feel even better about my purchase.

item.title: Our favorite elite Hi-Res music player has a record-low Black Friday deal – are you ready to go audiophile?
item.description: One of our favorite players from one of our favorite audio brands just got a very rare price cut

item.title: Save $2,500 on the EcoFlow Delta Pro Ultra — the ultimate Black Friday power station deal
item.description: Get the best Black Friday power station deal. The EF EcoFlow Delta Pro Ultra is on sale for $3,799 in the Amazon Black Friday sale.

item.title: Go big on Black Friday — the 3 best Black Friday deals on huge 100-inch TVs
item.description: Get the best Black Friday deals on massive 100-inch Tvs from top brands like Hisense and Sony.

item.title: Black Friday is the best time to get Samsung's stunning Frame TV - shop record low prices from $697.99
item.description: For Black Friday, you can get Samsung’s The Frame TV or The Frame Pro at the lowest price we’ve tracked. In fact, for most sizes, Amazon is actually a few dollars cheaper than buying from Samsung directly.

item.title: A New Way to Ruin Thanksgiving: Making AI Slop Recipes
item.description: Innovation at the dinner table.
